messages.title: Only Labour can beat the Tories in Chipping Barnet
messages.content: On 7 May you can elect a Labour MP who will listen to you, regularly talk to local people, get stuck into the local community and fight for a fairer society. Recent results show how Labour can win here. In 2014, Labour won 11 out of 21 council seats in Chipping Barnet. It’s Labour who can defeat the Tories here.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will put public services such as policing, defence, and our NHS at grave risk.
Labour will recruit 20,000 more nurses and 8,000 more GPs for our NHS.
Labour will extend free childcare to 25 hours a week for working parents of 3-4 year-olds and guarantee wraparound care from 8am to 6pm through primary schools.
Labour will freeze energy prices until 2017 so prices can fall but not rise.

Labour will ban exploitative zero-hours contracts, introduce a young people's job guarantee, raise the minimum wage to over £8 an hour by 2020 and prioritise investment in genuinely affordable housing.
Labour will prioritise investment in genuinely affordable housing.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Labour won 11 out of 21 council seats in Chipping Barnet in 2014, demonstrating their capacity to challenge the Tories in the area.

issues.economy: Labour will freeze energy prices until 2017 so prices can fall but not rise.
issues.education: Labour will extend free childcare to 25 hours a week for working parents of 3-4 year-olds and guarantee wraparound care from 8am to 6pm through primary schools.
issues.health: Labour will recruit 20,000 more nurses and 8,000 more GPs for our NHS.
issues.socialWelfare: Labour will ban exploitative zero-hours contracts, introduce a young people's job guarantee, and raise the minimum wage to over £8 an hour by 2020.

housing.content: Labour will prioritise investment in genuinely affordable housing.

leaflet.personalStatement: I have been home to and an active part of Chipping Barnet for all my life. I know some of the challenges we face - in supporting our local small businesses, in making sure all children can attend a good local school, and in ensuring we have good quality public health services, accessible to all. As someone who knows what low-paid precarious work is like, I am passionate about improving conditions and taking opportunities, and ensuring that working people are paid wages they can live on. I hope you will put your faith in a Labour MP and a Labour government to secure a fairer future.

images.caption: Amy Trevelyan, Labour candidate for Chipping Barnet.
